IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE, INC. (THE INSTITUTE) ENHANCES KNOWLEDGE ABOUT MODERN ISRAEL THROUGH THE EXPANSION OF ACCESSIBLE, INNOVATIVE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, ON AND BEYOND CAMPUS. THE INSTITUTE'S MANY PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES ADVANCE RIGOROUS TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND DISCOURSE ABOUT MODERN ISRAEL.
IRS990.Desc: VISITING FACULTY / TEACHING FELLOWS:THE INSTITUTE BRINGS VISITING ISRAELI PROFESSORS AND OTHER SCHOLARS SPECIALIZING IN THE STUDY OF CONTEMPORARY ISRAEL TO TEACH COURSES ABOUT ISRAEL AT AMERICAN UNIVERSITIES IN A RANGE OF ACADEMIC DISCIPLINES. PLACEMENTS CAN LAST FROM A SEMESTER TO SEVERAL YEARS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FELLOWSHIPS: THE INSTITUTE PROVIDES DOCTORAL AND POST-DOCTORAL FELLOWSHIPS TO SUPPORT OUTSTANDING EMERGING SCHOLARS SPECIALIZING IN THE STUDY OF MODERN ISRAEL.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: VISITING ARTISTS: THE INSTITUTE BRINGS VISITING ISRAELI ARTISTS IN THE FIELDS OF MUSIC, DANCE, THEATER/FILM, WRITING, AND VISUAL ARTS TO AMERICAN UNIVERSITIES TO TEACH STUDENTS, COLLABORATE WITH PEERS, AND ENGAGE WITH THE PUBLIC THROUGH PERFORMANCES AND EXHIBITS OF THEIR WORK.

IRS990ScheduleA.FactsAndCircumstancesTestTxt: THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE QUALIFIES AS A PUBLIC CHARITY UNDER THE "FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES" TEST OF 1.170A-9(E)(3) OF THE TREASURY REGULATIONS, BASED UPON THE FOLLOWING:1. ITS PUBLIC SUPPORT, AS REPORTED FOR 2017, IS 12.34%, THEREBY MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(I).2. IT IS ORGANIZED AND OPERATED SO AS TO ATTRACT NEW AND ADDITIONAL PUBLIC AND GOVERNMENTAL FUNDING ON A CONTINUOUS BASIS, THEREBY MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(II).3. THE INSTITUTE PUBLIC SUPPORT, AT 12.34%, IS ABOVE THE 10% MINIMUM REQUIRED FOR THE "FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES" TEST, THEREBY MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(II).4. IN MEETING THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(I), THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE HAS RECEIVED SUPPORT FROM A REPRESENTATIVE NUMBER OF PERSONS, RATHER THAN RECEIVING ALL OR MOST OF ITS SUPPORT FROM THE MEMBERS OF A SINGLE FAMILY, OR FROM A SINGLE DONOR. IN THIS RESPECT, THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE MEETS THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(IV).5. THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE THROUGH ITS PROGRAMS, AND GOVERNANCE MAKES AVAILABLE ITS MISSION TO THE PUBLIC. ITS PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES ADVANCE RIGOROUS TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND DISCOURSE ABOUT MODERN ISRAEL. IN THIS MANNER, THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE MEETS THE REQUIREMENT OF 1.170A-9(E)(3)(VI).

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE EVALUATED ITS UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO MATTERS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR THAT MAY HAVE ANY EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS.

BEFORE RECEIVING THE REMAINING FUNDS OF THE GRANT, THE ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A STATUS REPORT. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS REQUIRE THE INDIVIDUAL TO RECOGNIZE THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE IN ALL OF THEIR MATERIALS PUBLISHED DURING THE TERM OF THE GRANT. DEPENDING ON THE PROGRAM INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING GRANTS ARE EITHER REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A SURVEY OR SUBMIT A REPORT REGARDING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR FY18, FOR INDIVIDUALS, STAFF CALL THE GRANTEES DURING THE GRANT PERIOD TO CHECK IN REGARDING THE STATUS AND PROGRESS OF THE PROGRAM. DURING AND AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, INDIVIDUALS COMPLETE A REPORT ON THEIR ACTIVITIES. THE RELEASE OF THE FINAL GRANT FUNDS IS DEPENDENT ON THE RECEIPT OF THE REPORTS. FOR ORGANIZATIONAL GRANTS, THE ORGANIZATIONS SUBMIT A WRITTEN REPORT DURING AND AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD ON THE USE OF FUNDS. FINAL PAYMENTS ARE WITHHELD UNTIL RECEIPT OF THE FINAL REPORT.
FOREIGN EXPENDITURES ARE ACCOUNTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS THE ACTUAL NUMBER, NOT AN ESTIMATED NUMBER.
FOREIGN GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE ACCOUNTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS.
FOREIGN GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE ACCOUNTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: WASHINGTON INSTITUTE FOR NEAR EAST POLICY

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: GRANT TO SUPPORT ISRAEL STUDIES COURSES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS REQUIRE A STATUS REPORT TO BE SUBMITTED, BEFORE RECEIVING THE REMAINING FUNDS OF THE GRANT GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS REQUIRE THEM TO RECOGNIZE THE ISRAEL INSTITUTE IN ALL OF THEIR MATERIALS PUBLISHED DURING THE TERM OF THE GRANT DEPENDING ON THE PROGRAM INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING GRANTS ARE EITHER REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A SURVEY OR SUBMIT A REPORT REGARDING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR FY18, FOR INDIVIDUALS, STAFF CALL THE GRANTEES DURING THE GRANT PERIOD TO CHECK IN REGARDING THE STATUS AND PROGRESS OF THE PROGRAM. DURING AND AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD, INDIVIDUALS COMPLETE A REPORT ON THEIR ACTIVITIES. THE RELEASE OF THE FINAL GRANT FUNDS IS DEPENDENT ON THE RECEIPT OF THE REPORTS. FOR ORGANIZATIONAL GRANTS, THE ORGANIZATIONS SUBMIT A WRITTEN REPORT DURING AND AT THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD ON THE USE OF FUNDS. FINAL PAYMENTS ARE WITHHELD UNTIL RECEIPT OF THE FINAL REPORT.
ARIEL ROTH, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND ERIKA FALK, PROGRAM DIRECTOR RECEIVED BONUS PAYMENTS OF $15,000 AND $5,000, RESPECTIVELY.

THE INSTITUTE HAS CONTRACTED WITH A PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION TO SERVE AS THE EMPLOYER OF RECORD FOR THEIR EMPLOYEES. AS SUCH, THE PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR TAX FILINGS RELATED TO EMPLOYEES. THE NUMBER OF FORMS DISCLOSED ON PART V, LINE 2A WERE NOT ISSUED BY THE INSTITUTE, AND ACCORDINGLY, DO NOT COUNT TOWARDS THE ELECTRONIC FILING THRESHOLD FOR NUMBER OF IRS FILINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ITAMAR RABINOVICH AND LISA EISEN, AS AN EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHUSTERMAN FAMILY FOUNDATION, HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE NO BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETINGS DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE NO COMMITTEE MEETINGS DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FEDERAL FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS AND REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. THE FORM 990 IS THEN CIRCULATED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON DISCLOSES THE EXISTENCE OF HIS/HER FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AT THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING, BUT, AFTER THE PRESENTATION, HE/SHE LEAVES THE MEETING DURING THE DISCUSSION OF, AND THE VOTE ON, THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT THAT RESULTS IN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE, IF APPROPRIATE, APPOINTS A DISINTERESTED PERSON OR COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE ALTERNATIVES TO THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT AFTER EXERCISING DUE DILIGENCE, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES WHETHER THE CORPORATION CAN OBTAIN A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT WITH REASONABLE EFFORTS FROM A PERSON OR ENTITY THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IF A MORE ADVANTAGEOUS TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS NOT REASONABLY ATTAINABLE UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS WHETHER THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE CORPORATION'S BEST INTEREST, FOR ITS OWN BENEFIT, AND WHETHER THE TRANSACTION IS FAIR AND REASONABLE TO THE CORPORATION AND MAKES ITS DECISION AS TO WHETHER TO ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IN CONFORMITY WITH SUCH DETERMINATION. THIS IS WHAT THE POLICY STATES HOWEVER, IT HAS NOT BEEN DONE IN PRACTICE. MANAGEMENT IS CURRENTLY WORKING TO RECTIFY THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS OVERSIGHT AT THE NOV 2018 BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS DETERMINED BY USING COMPARABLE DATA THAT WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD. THIS PROCESS WAS DOCUMENTED THE LAST SECTION REVIEW AND BONUS EVALUATION WAS COMPLETED DURING MARCH OF 2018. STAFF RECEIVES EMAIL APPROVAL FROM THE BOARD PRESIDENT TO MAKE THE CHANGE IN PAYROLL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

THE INSTITUTE HAS CONTRACTED WITH A PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION TO SERVE AS THE EMPLOYER OF RECORD FOR THEIR EMPLOYEES. AS SUCH, THE PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR TAX FILINGS RELATED TO EMPLOYEES. THE NUMBER OF FORMS DISCLOSED ON PART V, LINE 2A WERE NOT ISSUED BY THE INSTITUTE, AND ACCORDINGLY, DO NOT COUNT TOWARDS THE ELECTRONIC FILING THRESHOLD FOR NUMBER OF IRS FILINGS.
